title: Plans to expand MRIA as an international airport
content: Tourism Minister Prasanna Ranatunga says that the measures taken by the government to transform the Mattala International Airport into an active airport will be further expanded this year. The Minister pointed out that it is in discussions with several of the world's leading airlines to launch its international flights. He also expressed confidence that these airlines would commence international operations at the Mattala Airport this year. During the last year, Mattala Airport handled 32,957 passenger flights and handled 722 aircraft, out of which 584 of them are international aircrafts. It is also stated that the number of tourists who arrived in the country from Mattala Airport during the period from 1st January to 3rd February this year was 2919.
